reviews.sentence: Nice Hotel in the Heart of Seattle. It was just minutes away from Pike Place Market. We walked down to the football baseball stadium to the game. Very good price for the location and view.
Family Trip. Great location price. Very good restaurant within the hotel. Very accessible to many parts of Seattle.

Fun stay. It was really nice and a fun area to stay right in the heart of all the touristy stuff. Blocks away from pikes place and water front view. We were just kind of bummed there is not a pool or hot tub and the breakfast buffet is 20 a person an was not that good. Parking in hotel was 40 for the night but kind of worth it since we did not have to drive anywhere. Overall it was fun and I would stay again for the price and location.

Hotel Motif. Seattle WA early March 2015. The hotel is very conveniently located in Downtown Seattle. Parking in the underground and secure parking garage is very convenient if pricey at 40 night. But that is the price of parking downtown. I had booked a standard queen but was upgraded for free to a deluxe King room and was quite impressed. Bed was very comfy clean room nice bathroom with an excellent shower. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

Solid hotel with a slightly hip vibe in a great location. Located downtown this hotel was exactly what we were looking for. The rooms were very clean and spacious. We had a room on a high floor looking toward the waterfront and could see Pike Place Market as well as the ferries come and go. Parking was fine but expensive. In retrospect we should not have rented a car. A big plus for going in Feb was that it was museum month and many of Seattles museums were half price with a hotel stay Motif was one of the hotels. This was the first time the museums had this promotion but look for it again next Feb in case they decide to do it again. Sign up for their frequent stay program to get free wifi. Also the hot cider was a hit with my daughter.

Motif Hotel Seattle Washington. Fabulous Hotel. Great rooms restaurants acomodation staff and walking distance to Pikes Market with fantastic shopping mall right across the street. I would recommend it highly and I found the prices to be very affordable for such a classy hotel. I am planning another trip to Seattle in June and I definitely will be staying at the Motif.

Trip of March 1 6 2015. This is a classy hotel in downtown Seattle with a reasonable price for downtown. Staff is very accommodating. Flkr Bar and Restaurant is very good and again wait staff are very friendly. Room was very comfortable. In walking distance to numerous restaurants Pikes Market the Needle and more. As in any downtown hotel anywhere parking costs although 23 per night seemed a bit excessive. Internet service was sketchy in the rooms but otherwise ok. I would definitely stay there again.

The Motif Seattle. The cost of the Hotel was excessive especially adding the additional parking charges. It was a nice place but certainly not worth the charges. Nothing outstanding nice place. typical downtown Hotel with restaurants within walking distances. Daily room rate was excessive.
Amazing and beautiful. Loved how upscale it was but a good price. Wish the showers were a little more private and there is no place to hang things in there.

Great location. Hotel was conveniently located just a short walk from the Pike Place Market. Room was clean and had a nice view their room service was expensive though and there was not much amenities but I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Beautiful hotel great service. Second time staying at the Seattle Motif and I was not disappointed. And the staff was excellent once again. The overall cost was more expensive than we had anticipated. The listing we had said our total was in CAD before we actually booked the room and then when we got there it was in USD So myself and the others staying in the room with me were a little unprepared to pay so much. Also the hotel does not have a pool.

Nice rooms poor service. The rooms are nice but nice rooms in Seattle are a dime a dozen. Alarmed at the incredibly poor customer service. From my room not ready at check in to multiple poor interactions at Frolick. As one example I asked for water one evening while dining on their deck and was told by the waiter that I could get my own water at the water station. That was after buying a bottle of wine and appetizers. t might be pretty here but the service leaves much to be desired and based on the price you can get better at the many other bouquet hotels in Seattle. Skip this one. they do not care about their customers.

Nice facility but probably would not come back. The facility itself was very nice the bed comfortable. My room did not come with the usual toiletries shampoo body wash even hand soap for the sink. I am not the only person whose room did not have soap. I am not sure how a hotel does not provide this to its customers. They also charge you a daily fee for wifi coffee water wine etc. that should not be considered a fee if you can not opt out of it. Also I was curious to eat at the restaurant hotel but it was closed for each of the 4 nights I stayed.

Stressed as soon as entering the hotel thinking we had paid 328 a night for this. The hotel location is the only pro for this hotel. There were only three stalls service for Check in with not so friendly service personnel. It was a long wait even thought I was the first in line. Lobby was small with a few seatings. Hotel was an old building which must have renovated too many years ago. Elevators looked old and worn. Room was so dark without proper lighting to see anything. Pillows were tiny size and very uncomfortable. Bedding was not very comfortable either. Bathroom was from old design with a dirty old looking bath tub. Bathroom courtesy variety kits were mediocre shower cap seemed was used and was put back into the box. We paid 328 a night and stayed for two nights. Hotel charged 1495 per day for hidden price hiking facility charge. I booked this hotel based on Bokingcom fake rating of 45 stars or 87. I would give this hotel a true rating of 3 stars or 78 but with the ridiculous per night price and facility charge I would not stay here at all.

Great place to welcome 2018. A very celebratory atmosphere for NYE and a warm welcome with champagne and hot cider in the lobby. The room was very nice. Excellent location. Parking is expensive and the pillows are like balloons too puffy.

Stay was great and location was perfect. Location room was very clean help was very friendly in all areas of hotel. Paying 15 for two bottles of water and Keurig coffee cups per day at a hotel that cost over 400 a night. Caffeine bar what joke. Eight Keurig coffee cups only two caffeine cups.

The hotel is amazing but I feel like the hidden fees are a rip off. The hotel as a bunch of hidden fees. On hotelscom I was told I would pay 90 night and it ended up costing me 300. Beware of the hidden resort amenities fee. The location is great though and the hotel is modern and nicely decorated. But I do not think it explains not showing the price upfront. There was a big construction site right next to my room. it is not the hotel fault but it was really noisy in the middle of the night and I could not sleep at all for one full night. So if you need to rest or are on a business trip maybe check if the construction is still going on. Finally the room is nice they added an Alexa device in each room which is a nice attention. You can ask for thing you might have forgotten such as shampoo or a toothbrush. Finally the bed were not comfortable in my opinion especially the pillows and the comforter. I like the super plush hotel beds and it is definitely not what I got. All and all great location but the hotel itself even if its really modern did not fill my expectations.
Pleasant. The view the staff. Expensive price for a alright room.
Exceptional. Great location clean and spacious. A lot of extra charges. 100 for two nights seems excessive in extra charges.

Nice suites terrible cocktails however bar management was so kind to offer complimentary meals on room service. I do n’t love the 20 day fee for “ amenities ” when the amenities is an Alexa tech in our room car charging and hotels texts. I do n’t need any of those things but I paid for them. It was a nice stay but it did n’t wow us enough to want to stay again.
